means: （使马）飞奔，奔驰( gallop的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: They are galloping around the garden playing football.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们在园子里飞跑着踢足球。

sentence.Network_en: The horse started galloping the moment I gave it a good dig.
sentence.Network_cn: 我猛戳了马一下,它就奔驰起来了.

sentence.Network_en: Japan is galloping ahead in the race to develop new technology.
sentence.Network_cn: 日本在发展新技术的竞争中进展迅速,日新月异.

list.abs: ...p）。其产生机制是舒张末期左心室压力增高和顺应性降低，左心房为克服增大的心室充盈阻力而加强收缩所致，因而也称为房性奔马律（atrial gallop）。来自右心房的舒张晚期奔马律极少见。

entry.def: When a horse gallops, it runs very fast so that all four legs are off the ground at the same time. If you gallop a horse, you make it gallop.

example.ex: Staff officers galloped fine horses down the road.
example.tran: 参谋官们骑着骏马一路疾驰而去。

entry.def: If you gallop, you ride a horse that is galloping.

example.ex: Major Winston galloped into the distance.
example.tran: 温斯顿少校策马疾驰而去。

entry.def: A gallop is a ride on a horse that is galloping.

example.ex: I was forced to attempt a gallop.

entry.def: If something such as a process gallops, it develops very quickly and is often difficult to control.

example.ex: In spite of the recession, profits have galloped ahead.
example.tran: 尽管还处于萧条期，利润却迅猛增长。

entry.def: If you gallop, you run somewhere very quickly.

example.ex: They are galloping around the garden playing football.
example.tran: 他们在园子里飞跑着踢足球。

entry.def: If you do something at a gallop, you do it very quickly.

example.ex: I read the book at a gallop.
example.tran: 我飞快地读完了这本书。
